quizA.title: General Knowledge Quiz
quizA.description: Test your general knowledge with 30 questions

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris is the capital and largest city of France.

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars is called the Red Planet due to its reddish appearance from iron oxide on its surface.

questions.question: Who wrote 'Romeo and Juliet'?
questions.explanation: William Shakespeare wrote Romeo and Juliet around 1594-1596.

questions.question: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean covers approximately 63 million square miles.

questions.question: How many continents are there?
questions.explanation: There are 7 continents: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Europe, North America, Oceania, and South America.

questions.question: What is the smallest unit of life?
questions.explanation: The cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of living organisms.

questions.question: In what year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Japan in September.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
questions.explanation: Au comes from the Latin word 'aurum' meaning gold.

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.explanation: Leonardo da Vinci painted the Mona Lisa between 1503 and 1519.

questions.question: What is the speed of light?
questions.explanation: Light travels at approximately 299,792 kilometers per second in vacuum.

questions.question: Which element has the atomic number 1?
questions.explanation: Hydrogen is the lightest element with atomic number 1.

questions.question: What is the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile River is approximately 6,650 km long.

questions.question: How many bones are in the human body?
questions.explanation: An adult human has 206 bones.

questions.question: What is the largest mammal?
questions.explanation: The blue whale can reach lengths of up to 100 feet.

questions.question: Which gas do plants absorb from the atmosphere?
questions.explanation: Plants absorb CO2 during photosynthesis.

questions.question: Who developed the theory of relativity?
questions.explanation: Einstein published his theory of relativity in 1905 and 1915.

questions.question: What is the hardest natural substance?
questions.explanation: Diamond ranks 10 on the Mohs hardness scale.

questions.question: How many sides does a hexagon have?
questions.explanation: A hexagon is a polygon with six sides.

questions.question: What is the capital of Japan?
questions.explanation: Tokyo has been the capital of Japan since 1868.

questions.question: Which vitamin is produced when skin is exposed to sunlight?
questions.explanation: Sunlight helps the body produce Vitamin D naturally.

questions.question: What is the boiling point of water at sea level?
questions.explanation: Water boils at 100°C (212°F) at standard atmospheric pressure.

questions.question: Who was the first person to walk on the moon?
questions.explanation: Neil Armstrong walked on the moon on July 20, 1969.

questions.question: What is the square root of 144?
Which ocean is the coldest?
questions.explanation: The Arctic Ocean has temperatures near freezing year-round.

questions.question: What is the largest desert in the world?
questions.explanation: Antarctica is technically the largest desert with minimal precipitation.

questions.question: How many hours are in a day?
questions.explanation: Earth rotates once every 24 hours.

questions.question: What is the main language spoken in Brazil?
questions.explanation: Portuguese is the official language of Brazil.

questions.question: Which planet is closest to the Sun?
questions.explanation: Mercury orbits closest to the Sun at about 58 million km.

questions.question: What is the primary color that cannot be made by mixing other colors?
questions.explanation: Red, blue, and yellow are primary colors.

questions.question: How many degrees are in a right angle?
questions.explanation: A right angle measures exactly 90 degrees.
